did.unittitle: Wine Institute Records on the American Wine Industry
did.abstract: The Wine Institute Records on the American Wine Industry includes winery survey data, county records, and regional growing histories; wine lists and menus; wine labels; speeches by wine scholars, producers and writers; promotional materials; materials related to wine and popular culture; photographs; film and video; and a small amount of microfilm containing biographies of wine industry leaders, winery information, historical data, and surveys.
did.physloc: Researchers should contact Special Collections to request collections, as many are stored offsite.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Wine Institute was established in 1934 to serve as a lobbying, promotional, and educational organization for the wine industry. Membership consists of California grape growers and wine makers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes winery survey data, county records, and regional growing histories; wine lists and menus; wine labels; speeches by wine scholars, producers and writers; promotional materials; materials related to wine and popular culture; photographs; film and video; and a small amount of microfilm containing biographies of wine industry leaders, winery information, historical data, and surveys.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection has not been fully processed. Please contact Special Collections in advance to request access.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Wine Institute Records on the American Wine Industry, D-242, Special Collections, UC Davis Library, University of California, Davis.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: All applicable copyrights for the collection are protected under chapter 17 of the U.S. Copyright Code. Requests for permission to publish or quote from manuscripts must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections. Permission for publication is given on behalf of the Regents of the University of California as the owner of the physical items. It is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained by the researcher.

scopecontent.p: Biographies of wine industry leaders, winery information, historical data, and surveys. This information is likely duplicated in print.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The world's outstanding wine authority tells you how to buy it, judge it, keep it, serve it, order it, drink it, and enjoy it! - How To Enjoy Wine - World renowned wine expert Hugh Johnson gives us an illuminating and amusing look at the more practical side of wine. Hints on how to open that stubborn champagne cork. Tips on proper storage techniques. The best temperatures to serve various wines. The right glasses to use. Selecting wine and the right amount to serve. To decant or not to decant and how to do it properly. Getting through the restaurant wine list. Author of Wine & Food and The World Atlas of Wine, Hugh Johnson dispels the mystique surrounding wine while he enhances your knowledge and appreciation. Now you can become an expert and find new excitement in every glass. How To Taste Wine - 1: Look carefully at the precise color, clarity and consistency of the wine. Swirl the wine to release its aroma, then sniff. 2: Take a generous sip, a third of a mouthful, and 'chew' it so it reaches all parts of your mouth. 3: Let the bouquet permeate your senses before making a final judgement. - Running time: 60 minutes. - Copyright 1985 Simon & Schuster Video, Simon & Schuster, Inc. - ISBN 0-671-61156-9 - 0 76714 02995 61156 - 2101 - Simon & Schuster Video - VHS - Hi-Fi

did.unittitle: California Wines - The White Wine Varietals - Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc, Johannisberg Riesling, Gewurztraminer, French Colombard

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Explore the classic white wines of California with America's foremost winemakers. This outstanding video program introduces you to the upper class of California wines, the white varietals. Yet, once you know them, you'll disocver that there's nothing intimidating about them at all. Your hosts are some of the most famous winemakers in the world, the people who make the wines of California. They know their wines like you know your children and with their guidance, you'll: learn the distinctive characteristics of the six major white varietals; understand a wine's coloring and what it can tell you about how it was aged; learn why some wines are better than others and how to tell the difference; witness the incredible beauty of Northern California's wine-making regions; master the vocabulary of wine and learn how to speak it fluently; discover new and surprising combinations of food and wine; and much more!" Color/Running time: 60 minutes. Copyright 1986 Kartes Video Communications, Inc. - ISBN 0-80430-139-5 - entertainment KVC, P.O. Box 40276, Indpls., IN 46240-0276. - 083227011394

did.unittitle: Vintage - A History of Wine by Hugh Johnson (Volume 1)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: [Only Volumes 1, 3, and 4 in box set received from Wine Institute] "The most refreshing voice on the subject of the noble grape, Hugh Johnson has captivated millions of viewers with his wit, clarity, and panache. Hailed as the world's foremost authority on wine, Johnson has published many books on the subject, including the best-seller Wine, the annual Pocket Encyclopedia of Wine, and Vintage: The Story of Wine, the companion book to this video series. "... a blend of stunning on-location filming and a narrator whos is engaging and unpretentious." -- The New York Times. VIN 020 - ISBN: 0-7800-0203-2, 0 37429-0141-3 4, A Public Media Incorporated release. Produced by WGBH Boston and Malone Gill Productions in association with Channel 4, London. Funding for the series was provided by the Banfi Foundation, philanthropic arm of Banfi Vintners. Volume 1 - Color - Four 29 minute programs - Printed in USA - Copyright 1988 WGBH Educational Foundation & Malone Gill Productions. Program 1 - First Pressing: The Origins of Wine - Journeying through the Caucasus, the cradle of wine, Hugh Johnson explores the wines of today's Middle East -- tracing the history of wine from its prized status in ancient Egypt to its prohibition in Islam. Program 2 - Drinking the God: Wine & Religion - In the mountains of northern Spain, following a Catholic mass, parishioners still douse themselves with wine in Dionysian frenzy. In discussing the history of Bacchanalian rites, Johnson assays the place wine still holds in Judaism and Christianity. Program 3 - Empire of the Vine: Wine in Antiquity - Since ancient times, wine has been "a food...an inspiration...a recreation," says Johnson. From Athens to the ruins of Pompeii, he scrutinizes grape-growing regions and marvels at the ancient houses. Program 4 - Northern Limits: Wine in Germany - Are wine consumers more sophisticated than their beer drinking brethren? It's a question Germans love to debate. Consider it, as Johnson investigates German wines.

did.unittitle: Vintage - A History of Wine by Hugh Johnson (Volume 3)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: [Only Volumes 1, 3, and 4 in box set received from Wine Institute] Color - Three 29 minute programs - Printed in USA - copyright 1988 WGBH Educational Foundation & Malone Gill Productions. "Program 8 - Wine and War: Madeira and Port - War and politics have helped shape the destiny of many of the wines now considered classics. In focusing on Madeira and Port, Johnson explains how they have survived all manner of turmoil, from devastating heat to imperial sanctions. Program 9 - Power of the Purse: Bordeaux Wines - Lafite, Latour, Mouton...each has a character as distinctive and splendid as the chateaux themselves. How can a single region produce such diverse wines? The answer lies in the vineyard, and Johnson tells why. Program 10 - The Devastator: Phylloxera - This insatiable parasite destroyed Europe's vineyards in the late 19th century. In highlighting the scientific ingenuity that saved the grape, Johnson reveals why today almost all European vines are grafted onto American stems.

did.unittitle: Vintage - A History of Wine by Hugh Johnson (Volume 4)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: [Only Volumes 1, 3, and 4 in box set received from Wine Institute] Color - Three 29 minute programs - Printed in USA - Copyright 1988 WGBH ducational Foundation & Malone Gill Productions. Program 11 - The Migrating Vine: Wine in Australia - It was inevitable that migrating Europeans would take their vines with them. With a climate "between the Mediterranean and paradise," Australia has become, as Johnson explains, one of the most successful of the colonial wine growers. Program 12 - The Grape Goes West: California Wines - Through a marriage of tradition and technology, California wines have won their place under the sun. In exploring the evolution of some now great wines, Johnson divulges America's homegrown secrets. Program 13 - Vin Nouveau: Today and Tomorrow - In his finale Johnson outlines the technology that will improve the future of wine making...discussing why vineyards will thrive in monsoon-drenched areas of Japan and how a winery in Tuscany was totally automated.

It provides an overview of the reasons we urge a NO vote on Proposition 134 and a YES vote on Proposition 126. This video explains issues such as: 1. Proposition 134 spends three times more than it raises. 2. Proposition 134 will cost all taxpayers, not just alcohol consumers. 3. Proposition 134 will lead to increases in our sales and income taxes. 4. Less than half of Proposition 134 monies wil be spent on alcohol abuse programs. 5. Educators are opposing Proposition 134 and supporting Proposition 126. We believe that once you have studied these issues -- which are found in the small print of Proposition 134 -- you''ll understand why Proposition 134 isn't what it claims. And, you'll understand why community leaders are supporting Proposition 126 as the better approach toward alcohol tax increases. I hope to see you at the polls on November 6th. Sincerely, Rick Manter, Executive Director - Taxpayers for Common Sense - NOTE: Additional copy

did.unittitle: Let's Talk About Drinking: A Guide For Parents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: An educational effort to prevent underage drinking - Provided as a public service by: Wine and Spirits Wholesalers of America, 1023 15th St., NW Suite 400, Washington, D.C. 20005, (202) 371-9792 - Copyright 1993 Wine & Spirits Wholesalers - Let's Talk About Drinking: A Guide For Parents is a documentary-style film which takes a candid look at underage drinking. Developed with the assistance of an expert health educator who counsels teenagers on a daily basis, it helps parents understand the powerful role they can have in influencing their children's attitudes and actions regarding licensed beverages. In the film, the unrehearsed comments of 13 students are balanced with a presentation by prevention specialist Frances Engelking, M.Ed., who advises parents about what they can do to prevent underage drinking. The teens speak with surprising honesty about why their peers drink to get drunk and what dangers they face while under the influence of alcohol. Parents who view this film and read its supporting booklet, Let's Talk About Drinking: A Guide For Families, will learn from experts about how they can talk confidently to children about alcohol beverages and enforce laws against underage drinking. Wine and Spirits Wholesalers of America developed this film as part of its continuing effort to prevent the abuse and misuse of licensed beverages. Please feel free to duplicate and distribute this videotape to others who share WSWA's commitment to preventing underage drinking. For copies of "Let's Talk" materials or other information, please contact: Wine and Spirits Wholesalers of America, 1023 15th Street, NW Suite 400, Washington, DC 20005, (202) 371-9792 - Copyright 1993 Wine and Spirits Wholesalers of America, Inc.

did.unittitle: Jancis Robinson's Wine Course (Tape 1 of 5 tape box set)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Introduction to Chardonnay; Cabernet Sauvignon and Sauvignon Blanc; Syrah/Shiraz and Riesling; Pinot Noir and Merlot; Fizz and Grape Invaders - Learn the Wine Secrets of the Experts - Wellspring Media, World Film Services - WSP 0130 - ISBN 1-885538-21-9 - 7 90658 79512 9 - Copyright 1995 Eden Productions. Produced in association with the BBC. Distributed by World Film Services and Wellspring Media, Inc., 65 Bleecker Street, New York, NY 10012. E mail: mail@wellmedia.com - World Wide Web: wellmedia.com - Package design: Wade Lageose for Art Hotel - Front photography: Larry Hawley - Artwork and Design copyright Wellspring Media, Inc. - Printed in the USA - Jancis Robinson, editor of the award-winning best-seller The Oxford Companion to Wine, is also wine columnist of The Financial Times and the Wine Spectator. She brings great humor and the expertise of a Master of Wine to one of life's most delicious subjects. Jancis Robinson's Wine Course introduces you to wine by focusing on the grape varieties which shape its flavor. This beautifully filmed tour of the world of wine brings labels and liquids alive. By sharing secrets of the experts, Jancis Robinson's Wine Course will help you appreciate and enjoy wine like never before. "Jancis Robinson is witty, brilliant, authoritative... of all the wine writers in the world today, she may well be the most gifted.", Robert M. Parker, The Wine Advocate - WSP 0132 - Introduction and Chardonnay - Start your journey with the episodes on this tape, which examine the range of the winemaking experience: from the joys of a single glass at dinner to the multi-national struggle where billions of barrels are at stake. Highlights include: How to taste wine - and why the nose reigns supreme; How wine is made - grape stomping as dangerous sport; The fast-changing world of wine. France may still produce some of the finest wines in the world, but it's no longer where the action is. See how Australian wine producers are changing the rules of the game; Soul, wine and tradition in Burgundy with Dominique Lafon; How Chardonnay is taking over the world - dining in San Francisco; The Magic of oak - how barrels, and fortunes, are made. - Color - Approx. 60 minutes. Copyright 1995 Eden Productions. Produced in association with the BBC. ISBN 1-885538-25-5 - 7 90658 79507 5

did.unittitle: Jancis Robinson's Wine Course (Tape 2 of 5 tape box set)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: WSP 0133 - Cabernet Sauvignon & Sauvignon Blanc - This program begins by examining the historic wine trade of Bordeaux, which is one of the world's most stratified. You'll then compare two startingly different approaches to winemaking: the traditional growers of Sancerre and Pouilly-Fume and New Zealand's resourceful, opportunistic Sauvignon Blanc growers. Highlights include: Starting your own wine cellar (and a peek at Baroness Philippine de Rothschild's); Chateau Country - the Medoc and the Bordeaux wine trade; Dining at Chateaux Margaux; Chile - dynamic new Cabernet Sauvignon producer; What is appellation controlee - straightjacket or sales aid?; Didier Dagueneau, the wild man of Pouilly-Fume; The new Klondike, Marlborough in New Zealand; Flying winemakers, the men who follow the sun to make wine all over the world. - Color - Approx. 60 minutes - Copyright 1995 Eden Productions. Produced in association with the BBC. ISBN 1-885538-24-3 - 7 90658 79508 2

did.unittitle: Jancis Robinson's Wine Course (Tape 3 of 5 tape box set)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: WSP 0134 - Syrah, Shiraz and Riesling - In this program, meet Marcel Guigal, who has created a wine empire in less than a generation. See why people will go to extraordinary lengths to buy wines from his three tiny vineyards. Then travel to Germany, where the wine trade is in a mess. What it needs is a really good scandal like the one that has left Austrian wine emerging like a streamlined phoenix from the ashes. Highlights include: What's wrong with corks - is your corkscrew really necessary?; Marcel Guigal, who makes Cote-Roties people will kill for; The Rhone Rangers of California - is Syrah the next grape of the West?; Scoring wines - behind the scenes with Australia's omnipotent wine judges; The Austrian anti-freeze scandal - and beyond; The world's most underestimated grape - the breathtaking Mosel Valley; Noble rot and the world's greatest sweet wines - bundles of ash or liquid gold? - Color - Approx. 60 minutes - Copyright 1995 Eden Productions. Produced in association with the BBC. ISBN 1-885538-25-1 - 7 90658 79509 9

did.unittitle: Jancis Robinson's Wine Course (Tape 4 of 5 tape box set)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: WSP 0135 - Pinot Noir and Merlot - In this program, consider whether wine expresses a particular spot on the globe, what the French call terroir, or the ambitions and capabilities of the people who made it. Then visit the Napa Valley, where paradise on earth is under threat, as a result of a tiny louse. Highlights include: Wine and health - how wine can do you good; The king, queen and pope of Vosne-Romanee - Domaine de la Romanee-Conti, Lalou Bize-Leroy and Henri Jayer in the heart of Burgundy; Oregon Pinot Noir - beating Burgundians at their own game?; Organic wine, hocus pocus or the future of the planet?; Phylloxera - the louse that's eating California's vineyards; Wine production as the ultimate personalized farming - Color - Approx. 60 minutes - Copyright 1995 Eden Productions. Produced in association with the BBC. - ISBN 1-885538-26-X - 7 90658 79510 5

did.unittitle: Jancis Robinson's Wine Course (Tape 5 of 5 tape box set)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: WSP 0136 - Fizz and Grape Invaders - In this program you'll enjoy champagne! Why does the mixture of gas and wine spell c-e-l-e-b-r-a-t-i-o-n? Then consider indigenous versus international grape varieties. Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon are the vanilla and chocolate of wine flavors. But would you like to eat vanilla and chocolate every day? Highlights include: How the bubbles get into champagne - tried and tested methods, and techniques too hot to handle!; Opening a champagne bottle the safe way; The young genius who's putting fizz into bottles in four continents; Epernay - a town built on bubbles - selling a dream; The magic of Barolo, Barbaresco and truffles - Piedmont in northern Italy; Spain's hot new wine Pesquera and the self-made mechanic's neighbors in Ribera del Duero; Seeking out weird and wonderful varietals, the bard of Bonny Doon, Santa Cruz. - Color - Approx. 60 minutes - Copyright 1995 Eden Productions. Produced in association with the BBC. - ISBN 1-885538-27-8 - 7 90658 79511 2

The New World Wine Video - Volume 1 - Niagara - Taking the snobbery out of wine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Running time: Approx. 1 hour - Hosted by Jonathan Welsh - "If you don't know what to look for in a wine, you'll miss it." - You'll never be intimidated by the subject of wine again! Free of unpretentious rhetoric and pompous rituals, this informative and entertaining video will help you discover: Wine terms; The influence of oak; How wine is "grown"; Aging; Fermenting; Tasting tannins; Aromatics; Body; Terroir; The balance of sugar and acid; Glass shapes; Importance of colour; Serving temperatures; Cork myths; Food matches; Swirling; Ullage; Decanting; Varietals; Vinifera and Hybrids; Processing; and the making of legendary Icewine - Television personality and professional wine novice Jonathan Welsh is joined by many of Niagara's internationally acclaimed winemakers to deliver candid, easy to use information that will enhance your discovery of wine forever. - Warning: This video is unpretentious, candid, delightfully informative and therefore not recommended for pretentious wine snobs. - Forevergreen Television & Film Productions Inc. - A Forevergreen New World Wine Tour Production. A portion of the proceeds from the sale of this video go to support the cause of literacy. - Running time: 58 minutes - A Forevergreen New World Wine Production - 1995.

The Lake Erie Region - Part II (120 min.) : Finger Lakes Region - 3. Canandaigua Lake; 4. Keuka Lake & Seneca Lake; 5. Seneca Lake; 6. Cayuga Lake - Part III (90 min.) : 7. Hudson Valley Region; 8. Long Island Region; 9. The Harvest & Crush.

scopecontent.p: Airdate: 11-17-91. Ambrose Video - 60 Minutes is the most-watched weekly news magazine in television history. Begun in 1968, the program's phenomenally successful blend of investigative reports, interviews, features and profiles have made it a national institution and continue to set the standard for magazine-format news programs. Good stories -- not just subjects -- are the criteria for 60 Minutes segments and the key to the program's success. Reports cover each subject from a variety of angles. Last year, 60 Minutes continued its high ranking among the television public, finishing in the top ten prime-time programs for the thirteenth consecutive season. Honored with virtually every major award in broadcasting, 60 Minutes has received 38 Emmy Awards, 5 George Foster Peabody Awards, among many others. The illustrious roster of 60 Minutes correspondents includes Mike Wallace, Morley Safer, Harry Reasoner, Ed Bradley, Meredith Vieira and Steve Kroft. - "No other show on CBS or any other network has ever approached it for impact and longevity" -- Tom Shales, Washington Post. "At its best, whether typified by tough Mike or elegant Morley, the show adds up to terrific television." -- John O'Connor, The New York Times. - Manufactured and distributed by: Ambrose Video Publishing, Inc. For additional tapes call: (800) 843-0048. In Vermont call: (800) 533-0024.

did.unittitle: California Wines - The Red Wine Varietals - Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Pinot Noir, Gamay Beaujolais, Zinfandel, Petite Sirah

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Explore the classic red wines of California with America's foremost winemakers. Whether you're an occasional imbiber or a seasoned enophile, this videocassette will expose you to a world of knowledge that few people are privileged to experience. You'll learn all about the royal family of California wines -- the red varietals -- from some of the most famous winemakers in the world. And with their guidance, you'll: witness the incredible beauty of Northern California's wine-making regions; become intimately familiar with the six major red varietals and their distinctive characteristics; understand the importance of aging and the optimum age for serving; learn why some wines are better than others and how to tell the difference; master the vocabulary of wine and learn how to speak it fluently; learn how to chill and serve the wine for maximum enjoyment; discover new -- and surprising -- combinations of food and wine; and much more!" Color/Running time: 60 minutes - entertainment KVC, P.O. Box 40276, Indpls., IN 46240-0276 - ISBN 0-80430-137-9 - 0 83227 01137 0

scopecontent.p: 1113 Spring Street, Paso Robles, California 93446 -(805) 238-0506 - Wine tasting the way it used to be -- friendly wineries where you can talk to a winemaker, sample his finest products, and enjoy the unhurried countryside of the Paso Robles Wine Country. Located on California's Central Coast halfway between San Francisco and Los Angeles on Highway 101. Paso Robles has over 20 premium, family-owned wineries and 7,000 acres of winegrapes.

did.unittitle: New York's Wine Country, WMHT Educational Telecommunications - - Finger Lakes Region [Part 2 of 3 tape set]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Part II (120 min.) Finger Lakes Region 3. Canandaigua Lake; 4. Keuka Lake & Seneca Lake; 5. Seneca Lake; 6. Cayuga Lake. - Explore the scenic attractions of New York's four major wine-producing regions, tour the vineyards, and meet the winemakers in this public television series. Join host Dave Povero as he travels from the shores of Lake Erie to the scenic Finger Lakes, and from the Mid-Hudson region to eastern Long Island, meeting New York's winemakers and learning the history of their craft. Part I (60 min.) 1. Series Introduction; 2. The Lake Erie Region; Part II (120 min.) Finger Lakes Region 3. Canadaigua Lake; 4. Keuka Lake & Seneca Lake; 5. Seneca Lake; 6. Cayuga Lake; Part III (90 min.) 7. Hudson Valley Region; 8. Long Island Region; 9. The Harvest & Crush. - Copyright 1997 WMHT Educational Telecommunications. P.O. Box 17, Schenectady, NY 12301 - To order additional tapes in the series, call 1-800-950-9648.

Papers include: Performance contract from Eye Contact International, Multi-Language Communications, 1435 Center Street, Oakland, CA 94607, (415) 836-1180, FAX: 415-835-1314, for Giorgio from Marie for Project Code: "Marjen Calwin", dated 7/26/90, for a two hour recording of a script on 7/30 narrated in Italian; 10 page script in Italian dated 7/27/1990 with File Name: "Calwin Fin", titled: "California Wine" with handwritten notation at the top of the first page of "Eleonora, Director"; payment request No. 1115 with Reference Code: "Marjen Calwin", for Eleonora Cappabianca to Eye Contact International for Service: "Directing", on Date: 7/30, at Rate: 40/hr; payment request No. 1120 with Reference Code: "Marjen Calwin", for Giorgio Cappabianca to Eye Contact International for Service: Voiceover, on Date: 7/30, at Rate: 45/hr; note on small post-it note on yellow lined paper dated 7/27 attached to contract for Eleonora Cappabianca: "Hi Eleonora (or Giorgio), Thank you for being available to work on such short notice. Gianpiero is narrating both of the videos and you will be directing him. We'll try to record the shorter (California Wine) narration on Monday and record the narration of "California Chardonnay" on Tuesday. Please make sure you are familiar with the scripts. Thanks again! Marie"; contract for Eleonora Cappabianca from Marie dated 7/27/1990 for Project Code: "Marjen Calwin", to direct for 2.5 hours on 7/30 and 7/31; two copies of 16 page script in Italian dated 7/27/1990 with File Name: "Calchar Fin", titled: "California Chardonnay" - Wine Institute, with each copy having a handwritten note in pen at the top right hand corner: "Gabriele = Hawley/Hobbs", and the other: "Giorgio = Thacher".
